snippet: The Pacific Research Platform will allow West Coast universities to connect on a high-speed network tens or hundreds of times faster than is typical now.
abstract: Five-year, $5 million grant from National Science Foundation will be used to create Pacific Research Platform, ultra-high-speed fiber-optic network; platform will allow researchers at University of California campuses and universities and research institutions in several other states to transmit large amounts of scientific data at speeds tens or hundreds of times faster than now possible on Internet.
lead_paragraph: The Pacific Research Platform will allow West Coast universities to connect on a high-speed network tens or hundreds of times faster than is typical now.

headline.main: Research Scientists to Use Network Much Faster Than Internet
headline.print_headline: Research Scientists to Share Data on Network Many Times Faster Than Internet
